VASSAL.build.module.properties.ChangePro.propChanger:
P,Active Player may end turn after playing a card.
Standard option End Turn Only draws no cards and will bypass this check.
To force End Turn with no checks\, see Other Tools from the main toolbar.

P,{(prefNoWelcome && ModuleVersion!~".*[abB].*") || !pFirstGame || prefDiagnostics ? "" : "

Welcome to Commands & Colors: Napoleonics\, Version "+ModuleVersion+"

"+(ModuleVersion=~".*[0-9]a.*"?" This is an alpha test module\, please ensure other players are using a compatible version and delete after use.":(ModuleVersion=~".*[bB].*"?"Beta test release
":"")+"Version 4 provides playability and cosmetic enhancements to earlier versions. See Help...Release Notes for details.

Players are recommended to use the same version of the module."+(gPlayerCount<=1?" Participants in your game must at least use a module version starting v"+gGameModuleVersion+".":"")+"

"+cJVMmaxheapMsg+"

I hope you enjoy the enhancements. Disable this welcome message and tailor your experience from Preferences\, Game Options. Support available via Help...Report an Issue.")+"

Mark B.

"}

Send 5 hits to opponent's marked unit

VASSAL.build.module.map.CounterDetailVie.summaryReportFormat:
{tStyleINF + BasicName + tBlockFmt + tBlock.repeat(Strength) + tNoBlockFont + tBlock.repeat(MaxStrength-Strength) + tHdgINF + (BasicName =~ ".*Light.*|.*Young.*" ? "1
2" + pNoBattle : "1") + GetProperty("pUflag"+IgnoreFLG) + (Retreat1 != "" ? Retreat1 + "→" + Retreat : Retreat) + "" + rngMax + "" + (BasicName.startsWith("British Line") ? Strength + "+" + (rngStBonus) + "" : (Strength + rngStBonus)) + "" + (Type == "Unit" ? (Math.max(0,(Strength + rngRnd)/2 + rngMvBonus- rngMvMalus)) : "NA") + "" + (BasicName == "Prussian Line Infantry" || BasicName == "French Line Infantry" ? Strength + "+1" : (Strength+ccBonus)) + (ccMvMalus != 0 ? "" + (-ccMvMalus) + "" : "") + "" + (NoXSW ? "No Saber hits except on Leaders." : "") + GetProperty("tNote" + BasicName)}

{tStyleCAV + BasicName + tBlockFmt + tBlock.repeat(Strength) + tNoBlockFont + tBlock.repeat(MaxStrength-Strength) + tHdgCAV +(BasicName.contains("Light") ? "1-3" : "1-2") + GetProperty("pUflag"+IgnoreFLG) + (Retreat1 != "" ? Retreat1 + ";" + Retreat : Retreat) + "" + (Strength + ccBonus) + "" + (NoXSW || LNCR_Level == 1 || CU_Level == 1 || COS_Level == 1 ? "" : "") + (NoXSW ? "No Saber hits except on Leaders" : CU_Level == 1 ? "Ignore 1 hit from Ranged Infantry
Lancers do not reroll flags" : "") + (MLNCR_Level == 1 || COS_Level == 1 ? "
" : "") + (LNCR_Level == 1 || MLNCR_Level == 1 ? "Reroll flags when attacking or
First Strike, except vs Curaissiers" : COS_Level == 1 ? "Ignore Forest dice reduction
Does not count as a Victory Banner" : "")}

{tStyleART + BasicName + tBlockFmt + tBlock.repeat(Strength) + tNoBlockFont + tBlock.repeat(MaxStrength-Strength) + tHdgART + (BasicName =~ ".*Horse.*" ? (Strength==1 ? "1-2" + pNoBattle : "1
2" + pNoBattle) : RB_Level == 1 ? "1-2"+ pNoBattle : "1" + pNoBattle) + GetProperty("pUflag"+IgnoreFLG) + (Retreat1 != "" ? Retreat1 + ";" + Retreat : Retreat) + "" + (GetProperty("rngART"+(Strength==1?2:1)) + ccBonus) + "     " + GetProperty("rngART"+(Strength==1?3:2)) + "" + GetProperty("rngART"+(Strength==1?4:3)) + "" + (rngMax==4 && Strength > 1 ? pStop + "
1" : GetProperty("rngART"+(Strength==1?5:4))) + "" + GetProperty("rngART"+(Strength==1?6:5)) +"" + (RB_Level == 1 ? "Special rules apply: see Allies-British Chart [F1]" : "")}

VASSAL.build.module.DoActionButton.name: Prepare Scenario Save - reset is mainly to initialise block locations, speeding game set up

VASSAL.build.module.GlobalKeyCommand.name: Remove warning piece from map (scenario prep) - piggy back on scenario prep key
Prepare Scenario Save
VASSAL.build.module.GlobalKeyCommand.reportFormat:
{isCompatible==true && (!isGameOwner || gPlayerCount>1) ? Alert("To amend a scenario, open the scenario and select this option again.
Scenarios should be edited offline.") : ""}

VASSAL.build.module.GlobalKeyCommand.name: enter build mode will fix dice tray (legacy issue) - change pieceId to 332- fix for v4.14+ scenarios that picked up 1922. Adapt this technique to fix older scenarios with bad dice trays.

VASSAL.build.module.DoActionButton.name: Also reveal hidden window, for the additional setup functions available - if River/Fords on the board
VASSAL.build.module.DoActionButton.reportFormat:
{prepBuild == 1 ? "*** Please configure impassable Rivers and any Special Rules for fordable rivers. Note that all river tiles default to Fordable River with standard restrictions.
Re-configuration can be done from individual terrain tiles or with the aid of the macro buttons on the maintenance window toolbar (now showing on screen) ***" : ""}

VASSAL.build.module.ToolbarMenu.menuItems: River: No battle restrictions,River: No infantry battle or movement restrictions,River: No inbound battle restrictions,River: Standard ford battle restrictions (default)
VASSAL.build.module.ToolbarMenu.tooltip:
Configure special rules on River tiles for battling and movement.
River tiles must be set fordable (this is the module default).

VASSAL.build.module.ToolbarMenu.menuItems: ...as Fordable Rivers (module default),...as Impassable (standard tile)
VASSAL.build.module.ToolbarMenu.tooltip: Set all River tiles as standard, impassable tiles or back to fordable with standard restrictions (the module default).

VASSAL.build.module.map.MassKeyCommand.name: Convert River to Impassable
VASSAL.build.module.map.MassKeyCommand.reportFormat: <b>All River tiles set to standard (impassable) *

VASSAL.build.module.map.MassKeyCommand.name: Convert River to Fordable River (default)
VASSAL.build.module.map.MassKeyCommand.reportFormat: <b>All impassable River tiles set to fordable with standard battle restrictions (default) *

VASSAL.build.module.map.MassKeyCommand.name: Reset River to standard
VASSAL.build.module.map.MassKeyCommand.reportFormat: <b>All River tiles (where fordable) set to standard battle restrictions (default) *

VASSAL.build.module.MultiActionButton.description: Remove infantry battle and movement restrictions from RIVER
VASSAL.build.module.MultiActionButton.text: River: No infantry battle or movement restrictions

VASSAL.build.module.map.MassKeyCommand.name: Convert River to No Infantry Restrictions
Convert River to No Infantry Restrictions - MOVEMENT
VASSAL.build.module.map.MassKeyCommand.reportFormat: <b>All river tiles (where fordable) set to no infantry battle or movement restrictions *

VASSAL.build.module.map.MassKeyCommand.name: Convert River to Fordable River with no battle restrictions.
VASSAL.build.module.map.MassKeyCommand.reportFormat: <b>All river tiles (where fordable) set to no battle restrictions *

VASSAL.build.module.map.MassKeyCommand.name: Convert River to Fordable River with no battle restrictions IN, -1d Out
VASSAL.build.module.map.MassKeyCommand.reportFormat: <b>All river tiles (where fordable) set to no restrictions when battling in, -1d battling out *

VASSAL.build.module.ToolbarMenu.menuItems: Fordable: No battle restrictions,Fordable: No infantry battle or movement restrictions,Fordable: No inbound battle restrictions,Fordable: Standard battle restrictions (default)
VASSAL.build.module.ToolbarMenu.tooltip: Configure special rules on Fordable River tiles for battling and movement.

VASSAL.build.module.map.MassKeyCommand.name: Fordable River (standard)
VASSAL.build.module.map.MassKeyCommand.reportFormat: <b>All Fordable River tiles set standard battle restrictions (default) *

VASSAL.build.module.map.MassKeyCommand.name: Remove Fordable River battle restrictions
VASSAL.build.module.map.MassKeyCommand.reportFormat: <b>All Fordable River tiles set to no battle restrictions *

VASSAL.build.module.MultiActionButton.description: Remove infantry battle and movement restrictions from Fordable River
VASSAL.build.module.MultiActionButton.text: Fordable: No infantry battle or movement restrictions

VASSAL.build.module.map.MassKeyCommand.name: Convert Fords to No Infantry Restrictions
Convert fords to No Infantry Restrictions - MOVEMENT
VASSAL.build.module.map.MassKeyCommand.reportFormat: <b>All fordable river tiles set to no infantry movement or battle restrictions *

VASSAL.build.module.map.MassKeyCommand.name: Fordable River has no battle restrictions IN, -1d Out
VASSAL.build.module.map.MassKeyCommand.reportFormat: <b>All river tiles (where fordable) set to no restrictions when battling in, -1d battling out *

VASSAL.build.module.ToolbarMenu.menuItems: Fordable River tiles don't restrict movement,River tiles don't restrict movement where fordable

VASSAL.build.module.map.MassKeyCommand.buttonText: Fordable River tiles don't restrict movement
VASSAL.build.module.map.MassKeyCommand.name: Convert fords to no effect on movement
VASSAL.build.module.map.MassKeyCommand.reportFormat: <b>Fordable River tiles set to no movement restrictions *

VASSAL.build.module.map.MassKeyCommand.buttonText: River tiles don't restrict movement where fordable
VASSAL.build.module.map.MassKeyCommand.name: Convert fordable River tiles to no effect on movement
VASSAL.build.module.map.MassKeyCommand.reportFormat: <b>River tiles set to no movement restrictions, where fordable *

VASSAL.build.module.ToolbarMenu.menuItems: Allow Cavalry Charge,Break Cavalry Charge
VASSAL.build.module.ToolbarMenu.tooltip:
Set or reset rule for fordable river breaking a Cavalry Charge
Note: Movement away is not detected. The charge die will need to be deducted by the players.

VASSAL.build.module.map.MassKeyCommand.name: Cavalry Charge ON
VASSAL.build.module.map.MassKeyCommand.reportFormat: <b>All fordable tiles set to break Cavalry Charge *

VASSAL.build.module.map.MassKeyCommand.name: Cavalry Charge OFF
VASSAL.build.module.map.MassKeyCommand.reportFormat: <b>All fordable tiles set to allow Cavalry Charge *

VASSAL.build.module.StartupGlobalKeyComm.name: Initialise - resetting for this session & welcome for master player
VASSAL.build.module.StartupGlobalKeyComm.reportFormat: {gPlayerCount<1 ? "*** Welcome to Commands & Colors: Napoleonics, Vassal module version " + ModuleVersion + " ***": ""}

VASSAL.build.module.StartupGlobalKeyComm.name: Initialise - release side changing
VASSAL.build.module.StartupGlobalKeyComm.reportFormat: {gPlayerCount<1 ? "*** Welcome to Commands & Colors: Napoleonics, Vassal module version " + ModuleVersion + " ***": ""}

VASSAL.build.module.StartupGlobalKeyComm.name: Setup Game will run first time - always if fresh game / Pre-Defined scenario
Setup Game will run first time - catches external game files
Check joiner compatible (harmless to initial player)
Default joining message - back-level scenario
VASSAL.build.module.StartupGlobalKeyComm.reportFormat:
{(gGameModuleVersion>0 ? (gPlayer>1? PlayerName + " joins using module v"+ModuleVersion : "") : Alert(cWelcomeHdr+"Incompatible game file: view and chat only or re-enter the game using a compatible version of the module.
"+(Count("{Cardtype==\"Command\"}","Allies Hand")==0 ?"To convert the scenario, see Help...Release Notes":"Do not attempt to convert a game that has been started.")+"") + "** "+PlayerName + " joins as " + playerSide + " using module v" + ModuleVersion + " *** Player should switch to a compatible module or keep to view and chat only ***")}

VASSAL.build.module.StartupGlobalKeyComm.name: Startup Alerts - must be after other STARTUP GKCs - welcome for players joining a game; warning to anyone starting/joining an incompatible game
VASSAL.build.module.StartupGlobalKeyComm.reportFormat:
{gPlayerCount>1 && cWelcomeAlrt!="" ? Alert(cWelcomeAlrt) : (gGameModuleVersion==0 || (isCompatible!=true && gPlayerCount>1)) && PlayerSide!=""? "*** "+PlayerName+" advised to switch to role and interact only via the chat window ***" + Alert("

Commands & Colors: Napoleonics, Version "+ModuleVersion+"

You are viewing an incompatible game or log file.

WARNING
If viewing a live game, please switch to the <observer> role now [hotkey ⌥R] and limit your interaction to the chat window only.

"):""}

VASSAL.build.module.StartupGlobalKeyComm.name: Set Roles & Name
VASSAL.build.module.StartupGlobalKeyComm.reportFormat:
{gPlayerCount>1 && cWelcomeAlrt!="" ? Alert(cWelcomeAlrt) : (gGameModuleVersion==0 || (isCompatible!=true && gPlayerCount>1)) && PlayerSide!=""? "*** "+PlayerName+" advised to switch to role and interact only via the chat window ***" + Alert("

Commands & Colors: Napoleonics, Version "+ModuleVersion+"

You are viewing an incompatible game or log file.

WARNING
If viewing a live game, please switch to the <observer> role now [hotkey ⌥R] and limit your interaction to the chat window only.

"):""}

VASSAL.build.module.folder.ModuleSubFold.desc: Editor does not support custom components directly. To add new items - duplicate / edit existing contents.
VASSAL.build.module.folder.ModuleSubFold.name: Scenario Database

VASSAL.build.module.RandomTextButton.faces: Command key reminders use symbols to represent modifiers: ⌃ Control\, ⇧ Shift\, ⌥ Alt or Option and ⎋ escape.,Multiple hits can be applied in one command via left-click on the Attacker and Target markers. A Rally marker is also provided.,Multiple hits can be applied in one button or key press. See the combat accelerators menu on the toolbar.,Players can apply hits and other combat commands without selecting the piece. Press F1 for the shortcuts help sheet.,Draw your starting hand in one go: check out the Draw Cards drop-down menu to the right of your Player Hand toolbar.,Special game counters may be drawn from the Markers palette [hotkey: F4] to form a stock on the player's side of the board. Counter stocks each have a right-click menu to draw or add counters.,Mother Russia: Drag a "Paper-Strength" counter onto a Russian FA\, LN or LT unit to upgrade that unit. Right-click to convert the counter to a Cossack or Fieldworks piece instead.,Press F1 to pull up the charts window. One of the charts lists the module's hotkeys and command shortcuts.,To show or hide your hand window\, press ⎋ (escape) or\, during a game\, click on your side's turn icon.,Simply press the Squaring button in your hand window to put your targeted infantry unit into square. For Battalion Mass\, click on your side's count of Battalion Mass markers.,Player Command Size and Tactician hand size are displayed on the Wellington and Napoleon icons to the left of the board.,Left-click on a counter store to draw or play a counter as applicable. [Preferences...Game Options: Mouse-Click Counter Actions],Command ⌃⇧H applies the currently pending hits determined by Combat Assist.,Hidden hotkeys ⌥Q and ⌥T will generate another Napoleon quote and module tip respectively.,Several features can be tailored to your needs via Preferences...Game Options tab.,Sound is optional and can be turned on or off for this module on the Preferences...Sounds tab.,Combat markers can be placed by drag and drop as well as by using the right-click menu or left-click on a piece.,The End Turn Options player hand toolbar menu offers end turn options for Scout special rules.,Hotkey F12 performs a normal end turn.,The Help system menu offers several useful resources for playing the game and using this module.,Zoom the map using Hotkeys ⌃[ and ⌃]. To quickly adjust a map view in its window\, try the "fit" options under the magnifying glass toolbar button.,You can claim a Victory Banner by clicking on an empty banner space. Click on a Victory Banner to remove it. ,Enable game clocks to keep approximate track of playing time in an online game. Press F8 to pause. Click on a clock to switch.,To detach a leader without marking the unit\, right-click on the leader piece and select the special command "Detach Leader" (shortcut: ⌥D).,Use left-arrow to access a unit and its right-click menu beneath an attached leader.,After playing a card\, left-click on a unit or its attached leader to order that unit. Double-click an ordered unit or attached leader to start combat. [Preferences...Game Options: Mouse-Click Battlefield Actions],Left-click on a unit or leader to place a combat marker (double-click on an attached leader). Attack markers are placed only on ordered units. [Preferences...Game Options: Mouse-Click Battlefield Actions],Clearing an Attack marker will reset Mouse-Click to "ordering mode". [Preferences...Game Options: Mouse-Click Battlefield Actions] ,See Help...Release Notes for detailed information about the module.,For best effect\, apply hits\, Leader Check and retreats in sequence per rules and use the combat marker "Take Hits" menu or equivalent key commands.,The introductory tutorial demonstrates key features. See Help... from the main toolbar.,Combat actions can be performed via hotkeys with no piece selected. See shortcuts [F1].,When Combat Assist is active\, hotkey [F5] takes the next action\, equivalent to clicking the Combat Assist widget.,If a unit is proving hard to mark for combat\, try dragging the appropriate marker onto it.,To ensure that a long logfile will save\, JVM maximum heap (in MB) should be at least 1024 (Preferences...General - module restart required if changed).,If a mouseover obscures key information\, moving the pointer will display the tooltip is a different position.
VASSAL.build.module.RandomTextButton.name: Module Tips

VASSAL.build.module.RandomTextButton.faces: Sometimes a single battle decides everything and sometimes\, too\, the slightest circumstance decides the issue of a battle.,Doctors will have more lives to answer for in the next world than even we generals.,I love a brave soldier who has undergone the baptism of fire.,If you had seen one day of war\, you would pray to God that you would never see another.,In war\, as in politics\, no evil - even if it is permissible under the rules - is excusable unless it is absolutely necessary. Everything beyond that is a crime.,In war\, morale factors acount for three quarters of the whole; relative material strength accounts for only one quarter.,Remember \, gentlemen\, what a Roman emperor said: The corpse of an enemy always smells sweet.,There is a moment in every battle at which the least manoeuvre is decisive and gives superiority\, as one drop of water causes overflow.,An army marches on its stomach.,An army's effectiveness depends on its size\, training\, experience\, and morale\, and morale is worth more than any of the other factors combined.,Between a battle lost and a battle won\, the distance is immense and there stand empires.,Courage is like love: it must have hope for nourishment.,Every soldier carries a marshal's baton in his pack.,God is on the side with the best artillery.,He that makes war without many mistakes has not made war very long.,How many things apparently impossible have nevertheless been performed by resolute men who had no alternative but death.,I have made all the calculations\, fate will do the rest.,If the art of war were nothing but the art of avoiding risks\, glory would become the prey of mediocre minds.,If they want peace\, nations should avoid the pin-pricks that precede cannonshots.,If you wage war\, do it energetically and with severity. This is the only way to make it shorter and consequently less inhuman.,In time of revolution\, with perseverance and courage\, a soldier should think nothing impossible.,In war there is but one favorable moment; the great art is to seize it!,In war\, three-quarters turns on personal character and relations; the balance of manpower and materials counts only for the remaining quarter.,It should not be believed that a march of three or four days in the wrong direction can be corrected by a countermarch. As a rule\, this is to make two mistakes instead of one.,One bad general is worth two good ones.,Read over and over the campaigns of Alexander\, Hannibal\, Caesar\, Gustavus\, Turenne\, Eugene and Frederic. This is the only way to become a great general and master the secrets of the art of war.,Soldiers generally win battles; generals get credit for them.,Strategy is the art of making use of time and space. I am less concerned about the later than the former. Space we can recover\, lost time never.,The basic principle that we must follow in directing the armies of the Republic is this: that they must feed themselves on war at the expense of the enemy territory.,The morale is to the physical as three to one.,The most important qualification of a soldier is fortitude under fatigue and privation. Courage is only second; hardship\, poverty and want are the best school for a soldier.,The secret of war lies in the communications.,There are certain things in war of which the commander alone comprehends the importance. Nothing but his superior firmness and ability can subdue and surmount all difficulties.,There are in Europe many good generals\, but they see too many things at once. I see one thing\, namely the enemy's main body. I try to crush it\, confident that secondary matters will then settle themselves.,There are only two forces in the world\, the sword and the spirit. In the long run the sword will always be conquered by the spirit.,Once I have made up my mind\, everything is forgotten except what leads to success.,There is no man more pusillanimous than I when I am planning a campaign. I purposely exaggerate all the dangers and all the calamities that the circumstances make possible.,To have good soldiers\, a nation must always be at war.,Two armies are two bodies which meet and try to frighten each other.,Victory belongs to the most persevering.,What my enemies call a general peace is my destruction. What I call peace is merely the disarmament of my enemies. Am I not more moderate than they?,You do not get peace by shouting: Peace. Peace is a meaningless word; what we need is a glorious peace.,You must not fight too often with one enemy\, or you will teach him all your art of war.,A general-in-chief should ask\, What should I do if the enemy appeared now in my front\, or on my right\, or on my left?,A rapid march increases all the chances of victory.,When an army is inferior in number\, in cavalry and in artillery\, it is essential to avoid a general action.,If you want to avoid a battle with a superior army\, occupy a good defensive position.,The transition from defensive to offensive is one of the most delicate operations in war.,As far as possible\, the artillery should cover and command the surrounding country.,When you are resolved to fight a battle\, collect your whole force. A single battalion sometimes decides the day.,When you determine to risk a battle\, reserve to yourself every possible chance of success\, more particularly\, if you have to deal with an adversary of superior talent.,Never leave gaps for the enemy to penetrate\, unless it be to draw him into a snare.,Encampments of the same army should be formed so as to protect each other.,Infantry\, cavalry and artillery are nothing without each other.,It is the business of cavalry to follow up the victory\, and to prevent the beaten army from rallying.,Artillery is more essential to cavalry than to infantry\, because cavalry has no fire for its defence.,Artillery should always be placed in the most advantageous positions\, and as far in front of the line of cavalry and infantry\, without comprising the safety of the guns\, as possible.,It depends on the general alone to conquer difficulties by superior talent and resolution.,The science of strategy is only to be acquired by experience\, and by studying the campaigns of all the great captains.,Once the offensive has been assumed\, it must be sustained to the last.,To advance or not to advance is a matter for grave consideration.,Even in offensive warfare in the open field the great secret consists in defensive combats\, and in obliging the enemy to attack.,It is an approved maxim in war\, never to do what the enemy wishes you to do.,Nothing is so important in war as an undivided command.,Never interrupt your enemy when he is making a mistake.,The battlefield is a scene of constant chaos. The winner will be the one who controls that chaos\, both his own and the enemy’s.,Give me lucky generals.,Fear and uncertainty accelerate the fall of empires.,In war\, chance is half of everything.,More battles are lost by loss of hope than loss of blood.,Winning is not enough if one doesn’t take advantage of success.
